snippet.textDisplay:
I do not know if this is just a fortunate turn of event for Microsoft/Windows or they have planned for this since the introduction of touch screen windows several years ago...
If they have planned all of this, then it is an impressive chess-grand-master move...
In either case, this is beautiful, finally some exciting new form factor for computing.

snippet.textDisplay: I mean the technology is cool, but IMO not very functional. I had a Surface Pro, and can't remember EVER using it as a tablet, because Windows GUI is designed to be operated with a keyboard and mouse, not finger based like Android or iOS. The folding laptop seems really dumb, so when I fold it does the bottom half become a keyboard? If it does, who would even prefer this over a traditional keyboard?

I had a Surface Pro, and can't remember EVER using it as a tablet, because Windows GUI is designed to be operated with a keyboard and mouse, not finger based like Android or iOS. snippet.textDisplay:
A naked silhouette stands alone in the doorway, illuminated by the studio lights shining into the room from behind him. The tall desktop tower casts a long shadow on the empty desk. Linus approaches, closing the door quietly behind him. The WAN show is about to start, and he doesn’t have much time. Linus squeezes thermal paste onto himself while caressing the top of the case, feeling its slight curvature as he searches for the power button. He then slowly inserts himself into the 1X slot on the motherboard, sliding between the two large, powerful 2080 ti’s, still warm from benchmarking. He begins to thrust forward with increasing speed and intensity. “UWU, harder senpai Luke,” he whispers to himself. The fans begin to spin, making a loud whirring noise and glowing softly in the dark room.

Linus hears another sound, rapidly approaching footsteps in the hallway outside. He is overcome by fear ... and excitement.

Suddenly the door swings open, and both Anthony and Luke walk inside, turning on the ceiling lights to reveal a startled Linus sweating profusely, and wearing nothing but a pair of LMG branded underwear! Anthony looks shocked, but Luke has seen this before.

“You know you are not supposed to wear the new merch items before they are released!” He says.

“ I couldn’t help myself!” Linus whines.

“What were you doing in here, by yourself in the dark?” Anthony adds, raising an eyebrow.

“I told you, I was trying on the new merch!” Linus replies in a harsh tone.

Anthony shakes his head slowly. “I just need to finish benchmarking this PC before we release the video tomorrow." He pauses. "And you are already late for the WAN show, Luke has been searching for you everywhere!”

Linus is deeply affected by this sentiment, and stares up at Luke lovingly, as Anthony carries the PC away.

Another close call, Linus thinks to himself, as Luke also walks away.

He grabs a blower style 5700 off a nearby shelf and shoves it into his underwear, for after the show.

“Oh yes, so close, senpai Luke,” Linus repeats, speaking softly.
snippet.textOriginal:
A naked silhouette stands alone in the doorway, illuminated by the studio lights shining into the room from behind him. The tall desktop tower casts a long shadow on the empty desk. Linus approaches, closing the door quietly behind him. The WAN show is about to start, and he doesn’t have much time. Linus squeezes thermal paste onto himself while caressing the top of the case, feeling its slight curvature as he searches for the power button. He then slowly inserts himself into the 1X slot on the motherboard, sliding between the two large, powerful 2080 ti’s, still warm from benchmarking. He begins to thrust forward with increasing speed and intensity. “UWU, harder senpai Luke,” he whispers to himself. The fans begin to spin, making a loud whirring noise and glowing softly in the dark room.

Linus hears another sound, rapidly approaching footsteps in the hallway outside. He is overcome by fear ... and excitement.

Suddenly the door swings open, and both Anthony and Luke walk inside, turning on the ceiling lights to reveal a startled Linus sweating profusely, and wearing nothing but a pair of LMG branded underwear! Anthony looks shocked, but Luke has seen this before.

“You know you are not supposed to wear the new merch items before they are released!” He says.

“ I couldn’t help myself!” Linus whines.

“What were you doing in here, by yourself in the dark?” Anthony adds, raising an eyebrow.

“I told you, I was trying on the new merch!” Linus replies in a harsh tone.

Anthony shakes his head slowly. “I just need to finish benchmarking this PC before we release the video tomorrow." He pauses. "And you are already late for the WAN show, Luke has been searching for you everywhere!”

Linus is deeply affected by this sentiment, and stares up at Luke lovingly, as Anthony carries the PC away.

Another close call, Linus thinks to himself, as Luke also walks away.

He grabs a blower style 5700 off a nearby shelf and shoves it into his underwear, for after the show.

“Oh yes, so close, senpai Luke,” Linus repeats, speaking softly.

snippet.textDisplay: Foldable displays are useless without proper integration with the software. These devices are going to be so incredibly glitchy and unwieldy on Windows as to make them borderline useless. As someone who just went from a windows laptop to an iPad Pro, I can safely say that a Windows device of any kind of simply out of the question until they can better integrate the hardware into the software.
snippet.textOriginal: Foldable displays are useless without proper integration with the software. These devices are going to be so incredibly glitchy and unwieldy on Windows as to make them borderline useless. As someone who just went from a windows laptop to an iPad Pro, I can safely say that a Windows device of any kind of simply out of the question until they can better integrate the hardware into the software.
